definition: to begin/to initiate/to inaugurate/to start/to create
to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots

sentences.english: He leaves with a record of 39-6 with 30 knockouts .
sentences.chinese: 他留下了創記錄的39勝6敗，30次擊倒對手。

sentences.english: A storm dumped a record amount of snow on the region on Thursday.
sentences.chinese: 週四，該地區遭遇強降雪天氣，降雪厚度創記錄。

sentences.english: The United Nations says world food prices have risen to record levels.
sentences.chinese: 聯合國說，全球食品價格已經上漲到創記錄的高水平。

sentences.english: Optimism among employers in Chengdu was at a record high, the survey showed.
sentences.chinese: 調查顯示，成都市用人單位的樂觀指數創記錄新高。

sentences.english: Whether it's a record remains to be seen.
sentences.chinese: 這是否是創記錄還有待觀察。

sentences.english: Maybe you can, but don’t try and set any records.
sentences.chinese: 也許你可以做到，但是不要試着創記錄。

sentences.english: The theatre has broken attendance records for three years in a row. (NETEM 2006, Text 2, Paragraph 5)
sentences.chinese: 戲院的上座率連續三年創記錄。
